data.title: Editor crash on open
data.body:
Atom crash when I try to open it.

The crash happens every time I try to open atom.

Clearing the window state and resetting to factory default does not fix the issue.
### Description

[Description of the bug or feature]
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Running command "atom" or "atom -fnw --safe test.txt"

What I expect:
The atom editor opens (a window containing the editor pops up).

What happens:
Either there is no change in the GUI or a see a window that says "The editor has crashed. Please report this issue to [...]"

Also here is the logs of the "atom -fnw --safe test.txt" command:

[4656:0819/205932:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(231)] Running without the SUID sandbox! See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/linux_suid_sandbox_development.md for more information on developing with the sandbox on.
App load time: 116ms
[4656:0819/205932:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(277)] gdkwindow-x11.c:5555 drawable is not a native X11 window (http://crbug.com/329991)
[4656:0819/205932:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(277)] gdkwindow-x11.c:5555 drawable is not a native X11 window (http://crbug.com/329991)
[4656:0819/205932:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(277)] gdkwindow-x11.c:5555 drawable is not a native X11 window (http://crbug.com/329991)
### Versions

OS: Manjaro 16.06.1
Atom    : 1.9.8
Electron: 1.3.3
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.3.0
apm  1.12.6
npm  3.10.6
node 6.3.1
python 3.5.2
git 2.9.2

data.title: Feature Request: Separate themes in config.cson
data.body:
Right now, the themes in `config.cson` are defined under one key.

```
"*":
  core:
    themes: [
      "one-dark-ui"
      "firewatch-green-syntax"
    ]
```

[Over on the forum](https://discuss.atom.io/t/per-project-themes/16064), a few people have requested to be able to change the theme according to their project. Some people design themes for specific languages or tasks. It seems like it would be a trivial change to split these to be under two keys, and that would allow packages or `init.cson` to more easily manipulate the themes without having to mess with an array and identify which theme is which based on the last word of the name.

```
"*":
  core:
    theme-ui: "one-dark-ui"
    theme-syntax: "firewatch-green-syntax"
```

data.title: Allow editor:indent-selected-rows to indent empty lines when only one line is selected
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Can't indent empty line
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Click into an empty line
2. Click _Edit > Lines > Indent_

**Expected behavior:** Indent

**Actual behavior:** Nothing
### Versions

Atom    : 1.9.9
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
apm  1.10.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 2.8.1
OSX 10.11.6

data.title: Atom creates redundant `/home/<user>/tmp` directory on start
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Atom creates redundant `/home/<user>/tmp` directory whenever I start it. I am using Ubuntu 16.04 and I find it pretty annoying to see an empty `/tmp` directory while my `TEMP` variable is set to `/tmp`.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the Atom
2. Check your home folder

**Expected behavior:** No creation of any additional directories in `/home/<user>`

**Actual behavior:** `/home/<user>/tmp` directory created yet again

I can reproduce the issue on any 1.6.0+ version of Atom.
### Versions

``` sh
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.9.9
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
```

I have no custom APM packages installed.

data.title: Folding Keybindings change to impossible values
data.body:
Atom 1.9.9
Windows 10

While using the German keyboard layout the keybinding of Edit->Folding->Fold changes to
Alt+Ctrl+ß

This combination can not be overwritten within keymap and is not within the default keymap since there is no ß.

This means I can't type a \ because it always folds the line which is quite annoying.

data.title: UNC paths are not supported. Defaulting to Windows directory.
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Heyyy, so getting this error an awful lot when working with projects folders and files from a network drive, very annoying :\

`Error: '[network samba drive]' CMD.EXE was started with the above path as the current directory. UNC paths are not supported. Defaulting to Windows directory.
Error: '[network samba drive]'
CMD.EXE was started with the above path as the current directory.
UNC paths are not supported.  Defaulting to Windows directory.
    at parameters.exit (C:\Users\Nicholas Carter\.atom\packages\linter-jshint\node_modules\atom-linter\lib\helpers.js:47:27)
    at triggerExitCallback (C:\Users\Nicholas Carter\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.9.8\resources\app.asar\src\buffered-process.js:215:47)
    at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (C:\Users\Nicholas Carter\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.9.8\resources\app.asar\src\buffered-process.js:237:18)
    at emitTwo (events.js:100:13)
    at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:185:7)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:204:12)`

data.title: Open folder in three on file click
data.body:
**Steps which explain the enhancement**
1. Double click on the file tab on the top of the IDE.
2. The file is automatically focus on the folder tree and the file highlighted.

**Current and suggested behavior / Why would the enhancement be useful to most users**

I was wondering if it could be possible to open the tree folder on the sidebar on clic or double click on file tab. 

If a file is open but the folder is hard to access or closed, far away or lost in all the opened folder and you want to access to a file near the one open, without having to search and navigate longer in the folder tree.

[List some other text editors or applications where this enhancement exists]

This behaviour come from _visual code studio_ and is pretty cool when you are lost in a big project and want to access faster to a folder. But visual have this behaviors on every file switch, which some time is not needed (that's why it could be cool to have this event oncli on click or double click on the file tab).

**Atom Version:** 1.9.9
**OS and Version:** OXS 10.11.6

data.title: Code completion doesn’t work when I split (not always and only in one side)
data.body:
Hello,
I'm in ubuntu 16.04, I just updated from the repo to version 1.9.8 of atom and now when I do: "open folder then split right" (same file to the left and right) the completion works only on the left but not on the right.
If I open directly a file and split it works fine in both sides (but not always).
What I did:
-atom --safe,
-deleted "~/.atom", 
-atom --clear-window-state.
Same results
I completely removed from synaptic and then install it again but nothing changed 
I updated to 1.9.9, repeated again but no changes.
$ atom --version
  Atom    : 1.9.9
  Electron: 0.37.8
  Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
  Node    : 5.10.0
$ apm --version
  apm  1.10.0
  npm  2.13.3
  node 0.10.40
  python 2.7.12
  git 2.7.4
[HERE](https://discuss.atom.io/t/code-completion-doesnt-work-when-i-split-not-always-and-only-in-one-side/32312/1) you can see a gif of the problem!

data.title: Atom crashes on opening file, if bare git repo is in the same directory
data.body:
### Description

The editor crashes if I try to open a file (`readme.md` in the picture), which is in a directory which also contains a bare git repo:

![folders](http://i.imgur.com/tT1niJ6.png)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Create bare git repository (`bare` property in `.git/config` set to `true`)
2. Add file to **containing** folder (e.g. a readme file)
3. Open that file

**On start:**
![crash](http://i.imgur.com/IoLVExz.png)
### Note

If the `bare` property in `.git/config` is changed to `false`, the editor starts as expected and vice versa.
### Versions

Windows: 10

Atom: 1.9.9
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome: 49.0.2623.75
Node: 5.10.0

data.title: Keyboard shortcuts not listed in menubar are resizing and moving the app window.
data.body:
Atom 1.9.9
Mac OS 10.11.6 (El Capitan)
MacBook Pro (built-in Apple keyboard without keypad/numpad)

The following keyboard shortcuts variously cause the app window to resize and reposition itself in seemingly random ways:
- <kbd>fn</kbd><kbd>control</kbd><kbd>any-arrow-key</kbd>
- <kbd>fn</kbd><kbd>control</kbd><kbd>shift</kbd><kbd>any-arrow-key</kbd>
- <kbd>fn</kbd><kbd>control</kbd><kbd>option</kbd><kbd>any-arrow-key</kbd>
- <kbd>fn</kbd><kbd>control</kbd><kbd>option</kbd><kbd>command</kbd><kbd>any-arrow-key</kbd>
- <kbd>command</kbd><kbd>shift</kbd><kbd>m</kbd>

Nothing is highlighted in the menubar to indicate which command has been triggered. 

Searching the menubar for "resize" or "reposition" or "move" produces no relevant results. 

**Update**

I've isolated the issue to an inconsistency with [Moom](https://manytricks.com/moom/). Which is odd, because I've never had trouble with Moom for any other app (native or third party). 

I'll send a report to Moom, but would any Atom devs have any insight to the trouble? 

The shortcuts listed above are supposed to move and resize the app window in predictable ways, but they instead resize and move in erratic ways with Atom. 

Thank you.

data.title: "Restart and Install" does not restart Atom after update on Windows
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

When Squirrel notifies about new Atom release, after clicking "Restart and Install" button on about view, Atom exits, update completes with some errors logged to SquirrelSetup.log but Atom is not restarted.
This has been happening during every update since I installed Atom 1.8.0 or one version before that.

Here is the whole [SquirrelSetup.log](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/426153/SquirrelSetup.log.txt) containing every line since update to 1.8.0 on 2016-07-03.

Possible cause:

```
System.IO.IOException: The process cannot access the file 'C:\Users\User\AppData\Local\SquirrelTemp\tempe\lib\net45\atom.exe' because it is being used by another process.
```

Might be caused by security software locking the file druring scanning.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open about view when a new release is available
2. Wait for download to finish
3. Click "Restart and Install" button

**Expected behavior:**
Atom restarting after Squirrel completes updating to latest release

**Actual behavior:**
Atom is not restarting after updates have been applied
### Versions

Atom    : 1.9.7
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
Squirrel: 1.2.4.0

OS: Windows 10 Pro, version 1607, build 14393.51

data.title: Command-a in Menubar/Help doesn't highlight search input.
data.body:
To reproduce: 
1) Press <kbd>command</kbd><kbd>shift</kbd><kbd>/</kbd> to trigger `Menubar / Help` search input. 
2) Type anything to populate the search input. 
3) Press <kbd>command</kbd><kbd>a</kbd>. 
- Expected behavior (convention for Mac OS native and major third-party apps): Typed search input should highlight entirely. 
- Observed behavior: Keyboard focus is lost from the search input, and the file's contents are highlighted entirely instead. 

Mac OS 10.11.6
Atom 1.9.9

data.title: Command-d fails to trigger "Don't save" in unsaved changes closing dialog (Mac).
data.body:
Steps to reproduce: 
1) Press <kbd>command</kbd><kbd>n</kbd> to open a new file. 
2) Type any character.
3) Press <kbd>command</kbd><kbd>w</kbd> to close the new file.
4) The unsaved changes warning dialog appears:
- Pressing <kbd>return</kbd> will correctly trigger "Save".
- Pressing <kbd>esc</kbd> will correctly trigger "Cancel".
- Pressing <kbd>command</kbd><kbd>d</kbd> incorrectly attempts to trigger `Menubar / Find / Select Next`. Standard Mac OS behavior is to trigger "Don't Save". 

Mac OS 10.11.6
Atom 1.9.9

data.title: Fix tab length deserialization
data.body: /cc @50Wliu 🎩

data.title: Does not successfully autoupdate on OS X El Capitan
data.body:
Version 1.9.6 on OSX 10.11.6
Running as a non-Administrator user
Automatic updates are offered e.g. to 1.9.9. 
When I choose to restart and install updates, the process begins but fails silently. Updates are downloaded but not installed. 

Example, 1.9.9 is downloaded to ~/Library/Application Support/com.github.atom.ShipIt, However, the App is never moved to the Applications folder and the required user prompt for credentials does not happen. In the background the ShipIt process is  - I believe - trying to move the application bundle but fails silently. 

Suggest you prompt the user for credentials if the process does not have the privilege to move the bundle to the application folder.

ErrorLog 

2016-08-18 17:54:25.060 ShipIt[55237:960562] Installation error: Error Domain=NSPOSIXErrorDomain Code=13 "Permission denied" UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=Permission denied}
2016-08-18 17:54:25.060 ShipIt[55237:960562] ShipIt quitting
2016-08-18 17:54:25.097 ShipIt[55257:960615] Resuming installation attempt 3
2016-08-18 17:54:25.118 ShipIt[55257:960619] Couldn't abort install and restore owned bundle to previous location file:///Applications/Atom.app, error NSError { domain: NSPOSIXErrorDomain, code: 2, description: "No such file or directory" }
2016-08-18 17:54:30.817 ShipIt[55257:960621] Installation error: Error Domain=NSPOSIXErrorDomain Code=13 "Permission denied" UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=Permission denied}
2016-08-18 17:54:30.817 ShipIt[55257:960621] ShipIt quitting
2016-08-18 17:54:30.852 ShipIt[55275:960661] Too many attempts to install, aborting update
2016-08-18 17:54:30.855 ShipIt[55275:960662] Error aborting installation: Error Domain=NSPOSIXErrorDomain Code=2 "No such file or directory" UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=No such file or directory}
2016-08-18 17:54:30.910 ShipIt[55275:960662] Application launched at file:///Applications/Atom.app
2016-08-18 17:54:30.910 ShipIt[55275:960662] ShipIt quitting

data.title: Reset display layer after deserializing an editor
data.body:
The display layer can't serialize all of its configuration, because some of them (`ratioForCharacter`, `isWrapBoundary`) are functions. So the text editor needs to reset its display layer with all of its parameters one time after deserializing.

Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12451

data.title: No window on mac
data.body: I have downloaded Atom 1.9.8 on Mac El Capitan 10.11.6. When I launch Atom (both regular and with safe option) I get the menu bar and no window: I deleted ~/.atom and launched again with the same result. I can keep opening new windows or opening files but all I see is the overlay you see in the image. A transparent frame (or several if various windows are opened) with no content. Any ideas welcome.

data.title: Atom 1.9.8 Crashes in Ubuntu in VirtualBox
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

I'm running Ubuntu Mate 16.04.01 in Virtualbox. When opening atom 1.9.8, I simply get a black screen. Here's what it looks like: [image](https://cdn-business.discourse.org/uploads/github_atom/optimized/3X/3/6/36164a2679a068687216c84493199d75f3df10e5_1_690x336.png)

I've run in safe mode, I've followed the steps in the debugging guide, I've reinstalled Atom. I even installed a brand new OS instance of Ubuntu (again in VirtualBox) and have the same problem.

I [brought this up](https://discuss.atom.io/t/atom-wont-open-on-ubuntu-16-04-1/32026) on the atom support forums, and it appears a number of other users are having the same issue. I also rebuilt from source with the same problem.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. [First Step]
   Install Atom in VirtualBox running Ubuntu 16.04.1
2. [Second Step]
   Open Atom

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
Atom opens
**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
Atom crashes with [this screen](https://cdn-business.discourse.org/uploads/github_atom/optimized/3X/3/6/36164a2679a068687216c84493199d75f3df10e5_1_690x336.png)
Sometimes I get this [error screen](http://imgur.com/a/7YYWv). If somebody points me to where these logs are stored, I'll post them.
### Versions

Atom 1.9.8, Ubuntu 16.04.1, running the Mate desktop environment.

data.title: atom.config.set escaping config values strangely
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I am looking for a way to set a configuration string to `"\n"` but the way escaping is happening this is impossible to do with the function `atom.config.set`.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Debug Console
2. Run this command: `atom.config.set('test1', "\n")`
3. Run this command: `atom.config.set('test2', "\\n")`
4. Run this command: `atom.config.set('test3', "\\\n")`
5. Open config.cson

**Expected behavior:**

```

  test1: '''
'''
  test2: "\n"
  test3: '''\
'''
```

**Actual behavior:**
The config is converting `\n` into multiple new lines as well as indenting them. Trying to escape the `\` in `\n` so that it saves as `\n` will cause the config set to escape both `\`s. Adding yet another `\` doesn't make things any better. It indents the double \ then adds a new line.

```

  test1: '''


  '''
  test2: "\\n"
  test3: '''
    \\

  '''
```
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

```
Atom    : 1.9.8
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
```

```
apm  1.10.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.7.4
```

data.title: Uncaught Error: Cannot read property 'object' of undefinedTypeError: Cannot read property 'objec...
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. ...
2. ...

**Atom Version**: 1.9.8

data.title: Tree view does not correctly indicate changed files (OS X, Atom Beta 1.10.0-beta5)
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)? no
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)? Atom 1.10.0-beta 5 on OS X
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)? yes
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)? yes
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported? yes
### Description

The tree view git indicator indicates the complete folder containing a changed files as changed. Not only the actual file.
![atom-beta 1 10 0-beta5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1379175/17770624/f4d96770-653e-11e6-9e22-9336a5a96579.png)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Create git repository
2. Modify a file in directory
3. Inspect status in tree view

**Expected behavior:**
Only changed file and folder name should be indicated as modified (as working correctly in Atom 1.9.8)
![atom 1 9 8](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1379175/17770609/e586cfc4-653e-11e6-8457-aedd785fd7c5.png)

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
All files and folders in the directory containing the file are indicated as modified. The issue does not arise if Atom Beta is started in safe mode.
![atom-beta 1 10 0-beta5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1379175/17770624/f4d96770-653e-11e6-9e22-9336a5a96579.png)
### Versions

OS: OS X 10.11.6 (El Capitan)
Atom: 1.10.0-beta5
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome: 49.0.2623.75
Node: 5.10.0

data.title: Unsaved files disappeared
data.body: I have a bunch of unsaved files that suddenly disappeared from one project. How can I try to recover them as I have important info in them?
